text:
Raskolnikov confronts Porfiry, tension thick in the air.  
Porfiry smirks, feigning innocence.  
Raskolnikov: “You’re lying! I see it!”  

---  

Porfiry chuckles, maintaining his composure.  
Porfiry: “Why so curious, my friend?”  
Raskolnikov: “You know something! Just admit it!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Porfiry asserts that he has no suspicion of Raskolnikov, despite Raskolnikov's anxious behavior and accusations of deceit.
